Description: Rim and body sherd of East Greek pottery rosette bowl; interior glazed black with red band lined in white; near lower edge of sherd narrow reserved band; top of rim glazed; part of one rosette preserved in rim zone; below, two sets of three narrow black bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Hayes 1992, 207, N19: "Ware as N10-11. Related to so called "Rhodian" bowls as Tocra I nos. 722, 727-32 pls. 37-38 and ibid. II nos. 2015-30, fig. 8 pls. 12-13, but perhaps a different North Ionian ware. Cf. also the Naukratis finds, Price (1924) 186, fig. 10 and CVA Oxford 2 II D, pl. 1.7. The dot-rosette is of an unusual type: cf. Tocra no. 720 pl. 37; CVA Cambridge 2 pl. XVIII 21 also some late wild goat style pieces"
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 207 no. N19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.817)
